intro: Hybanthus setigerus, commonly known as the hairy hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The flowers are usually pale blue or white, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
